title: Loading images from cache instead of sometimes downloading
content:
Perhaps I do not have something set properly.

I have searched.

I post images to my personal website (upload to directory via FTP) and then post a link to the image in various forums to show progress on my projects.

After I submit the thread and the images load (takes a moment on my slow DSL) I expect the images to not have to load again the next time that I visit the forum page.

But, sometimes when I return to the page, all the images are reloading... over the aforementioned slow DSL.

This is true with the many forums that I use... posting the same links to images.

Suggestions on what I need to change so that the images load from cache instead of downloading a new copy?

Windows 10 / Firefox / like long walks on beaches.

Thank you advance. Steve
creator: sccvermont

title: Clearing one site data and cookies wipes additional data
content:
Since recently (90+ versions) I've noticed that nightTab seemingly randomly resets itself to default settings which wasn't caused by browser wide cookies and data reset. After poking a bit, I've found a consistent way to reproduce this issue:

  1. Visit any site which stores cookies
  2. Clear data and cookies on that site
  3. Open new tab and have nighttab reset

Besides clearing out extension cookie, some websites also partially reset their settings, but not login information.

title: How to best manage the Containers site list - to prevent sites from breaking
content:
I am trying to find out if there is a way to manage the "Site List" for a container by either manually adding sites to the list or (even better) using wildcards.

The configuration that I want is to have multiple containers - but have the containers restricted to the Designated Sites Only. The problem that I am having is that OAUTH tends to bounce around my login through multiple hostnames on the same domain - so I do not seem to be able to add every possible host to the Container's site list.

When the "Limit to Designated Sites" setting is turned on (which is what I want - so I avoid accidentally getting my tabs mixed up) these login requests get opened in the default container - which breaks the login process inside the container.

Consider this as an example - with the hostnames made up. I am trying to visit www.mybank.com. Upon loading the home page and entering my credentials, I get redirected to id.mybank.com. From there, I end up getting redirected to onlinebanking.mybank.com.

Now, I can turn off "Limit to Designated Sites" for the first time I login and I can set www.mybank.com and onlinebanking.mybank.com to always open in my preferred container. However, id.mybank.com never stays up long enough for me to capture it because it does an instant redirect back to the desired page........and hopefully the middle redirection never changes hosts but they might.

The simplest solution to this would be to simply add *.mybank.com to my Container's Site List. Is there a way to do that? If there is not currently a way, can there be?
creator: david513

I have to open Chrome browser, log into the Tesco website to complete the payment there. I've phoned Tesco before and the guy on the phone said they recommend Chrome browser but I've never heard of a company doing that before. Surely all browsers should work.

It's just a bog standard Visa card I'm using so what could be causing this?

title: FF89/90/91 : Page loading perf Issues
content:
Hello,

I am generating html based reports I open locally thru file://<path> protocol thru FF89. Pages load at light speed. As they are relatively big (12MB+), with icons and graphs. It takes generally afew secs to load. Upgrading to FF90 and 91(.0.2), same pages take up to 3 minutes to load or even more. Tryed to open page via http server installed locally and same occur.

Auditing FF processes (on Win10x64, I7 8Cores, 24GB Ram, SSD), CPU is at 13%, no IO or very few IOs. FF seems to not be responding and I need to kill processes thru task manager.

I disabled add-on (just Ghostery), drop and recreated new profile but without success. Tryed different settings, Removed smooth control, HW acceleration, ... no way.

Same pages loaded from same laptop using Edge or Chrome are loaded correctly, in time, and does not show so long delays.

Anything that can explain such perf dropdown ?

Thanks

Cheers from Belgium

Th Even FaceBook does time to time freeze (pages not loading imgs anymore or unresponsive buttons). Have to kill FB to resume. This slowness started with FF90 and increased with FF91
creator: thierry.faidherbe

title: Extensions automatically restart
content:
Today I clicked on the Ghostery button to temporarily disable it, to see if doing that would solve a problem on a Web site. (Doing so a few days ago had solved a similar problem on another site.)

But a few seconds after clicking the button to turn it off, and the button changing from blue to gray, the button automatically changed back to blue, turning Ghostery back on again.

So I tried the other extensions. (I have just a few.)

Each one behaved exactly the same way!

What has changed? What is going on?

I'll run a virus scan, but can't think someone would bother to write malware to do something that trivial.

Thanks, Bill Mathews FF 91.0.2

title: Australian Gov HTTPS (BOM) access problems - Weather/radar Site - Bureau of Meteorology (Australia) – not working under HTTPS and Firefox.
content: 31-August 2021 . Hi all, recently the Australian government , “Bureau of Meteorology” weather and radar – website has stopped working under HTTPS and FireFox – it does work under Microsoft Edge though (Yuk). . Unfortunately even if under the FireFox internal settings - you disable the need for a HTTPS connection – the website still kicks you out anyway – and any direct call to the site (http://www.bom.gov.au) – will just kick you to an endless loop of no achievement – by basically constantly telling you “you cannot use HTTPS” and the HTTP link provided just loops you back to the same place. . For now – the only solution I have found is to leave “HTTPS” on – and create an exception for every single page (very zzzzz). . So for me , I am only excepting and viewing the local weather radar page and getting all other info from other sources. . Machine specs - Win10 Pro , Firefox Version 91.0.2 (64-bit) . I have also (via Edge) – reported this to the “BOM” in Australia, . I hope this helps someone , as I cannot be the only person in Australia trying to access this site – but having to sign up - to report the problem here, I did find more than a bit off putting.
creator: ponytrekker
